t: Ecclesiastes 8
Who*pn is*i like a wise man?*i And*ld who knows the interpretation of a thing? A*ld man’s wisdom makes his face shine, And*ld the sternness of his face is changed.
Obey Authorities for God’s Sake
I*p say,*i “Keep the king’s commandment for the sake of your oath to God.
Do not be hasty to go from his presence. Do not take your stand for an evil thing, for he does whatever pleases him.”
Where*pn the word of a king is,*i there*i is*i power; And*ld who may say to him, “What are you doing?”
He*ld who keeps his command will experience nothing harmful; And*ld a wise man’s heart discerns both time and judgment,
Because*ld for every matter there is a time and judgment, Though*ld the misery of man increases greatly.
For*ld he does not know what will happen; So*ld who can tell him when it will occur?

No*ld one has power over the spirit to retain the spirit, And*ld no one has power in the day of death. There*ild is*i no release from that war, And*ld wickedness will not deliver those who are given to it.
All*p this I have seen, and applied my heart to every work that is done under the sun: There*i is*i a time in which one man rules over another to his own hurt.
Death Comes to All
Then*p I saw the wicked buried, who had come and gone from the place of holiness, and they were forgotten in the city where they had so done. This also is*i vanity.
Because the sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.
Though a sinner does evil a hundred times,*i and his days*i are prolonged, yet I surely know that it will be well with those who fear God, who fear before Him.
But it will not be well with the wicked; nor will he prolong his*i days, which*i are*i as a shadow, because he does not fear before God.

There*p is a vanity which occurs on earth, that there are just men*i to whom it happens according to the work of the wicked; again, there are wicked men*i to whom it happens according to the work of the righteous. I said that this also is*i vanity.

So*p I commended enjoyment, because a man has nothing better under the sun than to eat, drink, and be merry; for this will remain with him in his labor all*i the days of his life which God gives him under the sun.
When*p I applied my heart to know wisdom and to see the business that is done on earth, even though one sees no sleep day or night,

then I saw all the work of God, that a man cannot find out the work that is done under the sun. For though a man labors to discover it,*i yet he will not find it;*i moreover, though a wise man*i attempts to know it,*i he will not be able to find it.*i
